poem:
**A New Leader Emerges**

In the corridors of power, voices hum,  
Badenoch steps onto the stage,  
her shadow cabinet waits in wings,  
Tuesday's glance across the page.

Rules twist like ivy in autumn breeze,  
unshaken amidst the swaying fray;  
confidence, a coin tossed high,  
as time grasps a fleeting day.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tory leadership election live: Kemi Badenoch elected new Conservative leader 12.07pm GMT Kemi Badenoch wants to have a new shadow cabinet in place before Tuesday, when the first shadow cabinet meeting under her leadership is due to take place, her team say. But they say she is not planning to announce any appointments today. 12.05pm GMT Tories change rules to make it harder for MPs to trigger no confidence vote in new leader The Conservative". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
